Previous: śuṣ2Next: śṛ

√śū 'swell'

present: śváyati etc.  

perfect: śuśāva  śiśvāya  śūśuvus etc.  śūśuvat  śūśuve  śū́śuvāna  

aorist: [1.] śūyāt   -- [2.] áśvat   -- [3.] aśiśviyat  aśūśuvat  aśiśvayat   -- [5.] aśvayīt  

[future: śvayiṣyati  śvayitā  ]

verbal: śváyitum  śūṣáṇi  

secondary: śūyate  śośu-  śeśvi-  śiśvayiṣa-  śvāyaya-  

derivatives: -śū?  śáva B.+  śāva E.+  -śvan V.+  śávas V.+  śavasāná RV.  śáviṣṭha V.B.  śotha C.  śuná V.B.S.  śū́na V.+  śū́nyá V.+  śū́ra V.+  śávīra RV.  śivá V.+  śéva V.+  -śévas AV.  -śvāyin B.  śvayana C.  śvayátha B.  śvayathu C.  śvātrá V.B.  śvāntá RV.  śíśu V.+  -śíśvan RV.  -śiśvi RV.  

The perfect forms in RV. are ascribed by BR. (perhaps with better reason) to a separate root śū 'prevail'. The connection of a part of the derivatives given here with one another and with any assignable root is open to much question.
